Structure.Name: CallForTenders 0.1
Structure.Description: Document type is a respons to economic operator interest of procurement project with or without ESPD schema

Element.Name: UBL Version identifier
Element.Description: Requires UBL version 2.2

Element.Name: Call for tender identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the call for tender as issued by the contracting body.

Element.Name: Call for tender issue date
Element.Description: The date on which the call for tender is issued.

Element.Name: Call for tender issue time
Element.Description: Time of issue of a call for tender. The time zone has to be informed following the BII Guideline on Data Formats.

Element.Name: Reference number
Element.Description: An identifier that is specified by the buyer and used as a reference number for all documents in the procurement process. It is also known as procurement project identifier, procurement reference number or contract folder identifier.

Element.Name: Call for tender version
Element.Description: Identifies the version of the call for tenders.

Element.Name: Call for tender previous identifier
Element.Description: Identifies a previously issued call for tender when updated by the contracting body.

Element.Name: Tender procurement documents URI
Element.Description: URI from where tenderers and interested economic operators can access procurement documents.

Element.Name: Submission of tenders and requests to participate URI
Element.Description: The URI where the tenderer provides ï¿½the submission.

Attribute.Reference: Must be according to PEPPOL Policy for use of identifiers, policy 8

Element.Name: Variants indicator
Element.Description: Indicates if variants are accepted in the tender. Use true when variants are allowed.

Element.Name: Maximum number of variants to submit
Element.Description: Maximum number of variants a tenderer can submit.

Element.Name: Legal references
Element.Description: Textual description of references to specific legislation

Element.Name: Required number of copies
Element.Description: Required number of paper copies to submit if using postal submission.

Element.Name: Overall expected level of tender signature
Element.Description: Expected level of signature to be used by the tenderer when submitting the tenders.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears. It enables the buyer to process the document in an appropriate way.

Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.

Element.Name: Contracting body name
Element.Description: The name of the contracting body as it is registered.

Element.Name: Contracting body identifier
Element.Description: The national identifier of a contracting body as it is legally registered (e.g. VAT identification, such as KBO)

Element.Name: Contracting body electronic address identifier
Element.Description: Electronic address of the contracting body.

Element.Name: Country of registration
Element.Description: The country where the party is registered. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2

Element.Name: Procedure type
Element.Description: A code specifying the type of this tendering process. The coded version of the description of procedure. (E.g.) Open procedure, negotiated etc.

Element.Name: Tender submission deadline
Element.Description: Time limit for receipt of tenders (open procedures) or requests to participate (restricted procedures, competitive procedures with negotiation, dynamic purchasing systems, competitive dialogues, innovation partnerships)

Element.Name: Tender submission deadline
Element.Description: Time limit for receipt of tenders (open procedures) or requests to participate (restricted procedures, competitive procedures with negotiation, dynamic purchasing systems, competitive dialogues, innovation partnerships)

Element.Name: Request for participation deadline
Element.Description: The date and time before which documents are available for access or may be requested and before which requests to participate must be received.

Element.Name: Request for participation deadline
Element.Description: The date and time before which documents are available for access or may be requested and before which requests to participate must be received.

Element.Name: Type of contract to establish
Element.Description: Specifies that the aim of the awarding process is to establish a public contract or to setup a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system. For framework agreement and DPS, indicates whether the new contract will be based on an already established framework agreement or dynamic purchasing system or not.

Element.Name: Backup for electronic submission indicator
Element.Description: Indicator whether postal submission of the tender is merely a backup for the electronic submission

Element.Name: Procurement project name
Element.Description: Title attributed to the contract by the contracting body.

Element.Name: Procurement project description
Element.Description: A textual description of this Procurement project.

Element.Name: Procurement project type
Element.Description: Type of contract (Works, Supplies or Services).

Element.Name: CPV
Element.Description: Classification code of goods, works and services commonly used in procurement.

Element.Name: CPV supplementary
Element.Description: A supplementary code to help contracting bodies describe the subject matter of contracts comprehensively.

Element.Name: Procurement project location NUTS code
Element.Description: The identification with the NUTS code of the project location.

Element.Name: Lot reference
Element.Description: A reference to one or more lots the economic operator is applying for. The original lot definition is part of the call for tender document. The Qualification instance only references the corresponding IDs in order to establish the connection to the call for tender information.

Element.Name: Document type code
Element.Description: A code specifying the type of the document.

Element.Name: Document issue date
Element.Description: Date when the referred document was issued.

Element.Name: Provided document version
Element.Description: Version of a document that is provided as part of a tender or call for tender.

Element.Name: Provided document name
Element.Description: Name of a document that is provided as part of a tender or call for tender.

Element.Name: Document mime type code
Element.Description: Stands for

Element.Name: Provided document url
Element.Description: URL where a document that is provided as part of a call for tender can be downloaded.

Element.Name: Provided document language
Element.Description: Language of a document that is provided as part of a call for tender.

Element.Name: Provided document to be returned indicator
Element.Description: Indicates that the provided document in the call for tender has to be returned as part of the tender.

Element.Name: Required document reference identifier
Element.Description: Reference identifier for a required document for a tender.

Element.Name: Lot identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the lot.

Element.Name: Lot name
Element.Description: The title of the lot
